solution_line_template: If each movie ticket is sold at ${movie_ticket_price}, the cost of buying eight movie tickets is {num_movie_tickets}*${movie_ticket_price} = ${cost_eight_movie_tickets}<<{num_movie_tickets}*{movie_ticket_price}={cost_eight_movie_tickets}>>{cost_eight_movie_tickets}

Since eight movie tickets cost {cost_multiplier} times as much as one football game ticket, the cost of buying one football game ticket is ${cost_eight_movie_tickets}/{cost_multiplier} = ${cost_one_football_ticket}<<{cost_eight_movie_tickets}/{cost_multiplier}={cost_one_football_ticket}>>{cost_one_football_ticket}

Buying {num_football_tickets} football game tickets will cost {num_football_tickets}*${cost_one_football_ticket} = ${cost_five_football_tickets}<<{num_football_tickets}*{cost_one_football_ticket}={cost_five_football_tickets}>>{cost_five_football_tickets}
The total cost of buying eight movie tickets and five football game tickets is ${cost_five_football_tickets}+${cost_eight_movie_tickets} = ${total_cost}
